title: Statement, contents, use
context: §332-4 Statement, contents, use. Whenever the word &ldquo;felt&rdquo;, as applied to cotton, is used in the statement concerning materials, it shall be indicated in the statement whether the felt is &ldquo;felted cotton&rdquo; or &ldquo;felted linters&rdquo;. This requirement shall not apply to comforters. It shall be unlawful to use in the statement concerning any mattress the word &ldquo;floss&rdquo; or words of like import, if there has been used in filling the mattress any materials which are not termed as &ldquo;kapok&rdquo;. It shall be unlawful to use in the statement concerning any mattress the word &ldquo;hair&rdquo; unless the mattress is entirely manufactured of animals&rsquo; hair. It shall be unlawful to use in the description in the statement any misleading term or designation, or term or designation likely to mislead. [L 1927, c 234, §§4 to 7; RL 1935, §1193; RL 1945, §2474; RL 1955, §55-4; HRS §332-4]
